title: Seemingly random FPS drops
body:
So I've been getting these random fps drops recently, starting at least two weeks ago. I suppose drop isn't the right word, because I typically get about 200+ fps and these drops plunge me down into the range of about 15 for about a second, which results in the game appearing to seize up. Some background: my PC is higher end of the custom market, my ping is about 24-27 and I don't have anything intensive running I play I stick the setting down to the lowest.
So when this happens I lose about a second or two of gameplay, which has been lethal to me and my team. I ran through the list of 'fixes' recommends (side note: "disable all ingame sounds"? Seriously?). Still no positive change. Anybody have any alternative ideas to keep this game from chugging harder than a PC trying to showcase the Fallout 4 mini-nuke minigun?

Edit: tried verifying the game a second time, because I'm honestly out of ideas. Now I need to reboot the whole client to actually get into the actual gameplay. Soooo, yeah. Now I'm really unhappy.

replies.body:
How many background apps do you have running, and do any of them draw over League. It may be a good idea to [**perform a quick clean boot**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) just to ensure that your background applications aren't exacerbating or causing the situation.

If you're still seeing issues after confirming that you've already tried all the steps in the guide I linked, let me know.
